channel.title: Switching from Xp
channel.description:
I am deciding to move from XP to vista, because recently just bought Halo 2 for Windows Vista, and my computer is compatible with Vista, so where are some good places to go to learn to change OP systems?
I do understand Vista is total shit, but idc.

item.title: Switching from Xp
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

They do still give vista keys out (under certain conditions) cause I have like 5 keys for vista if not more which I got a few months ago. You’ll be able to get a product key pretty cheap considering I’ve been trying to flog em and nobody wants them haha!
Just go win7, win7 is good;p.

Burn the iso image you download onto a disc then boot from disc and set it up. You can boot from usb also but allegedly its not as good. Then set it up as you would normally do with any OS.

Read full topic

item.title: Switching from Xp
item.dc:creator: @pk2play pk2play
item.description:
@pk2play wrote:

[quote=“Jacob_, post:3, topic:443176”][quote author=Lin link=topic=545863.msg4001363#msg4001363 date=1338058050]
Go with Windows 7. You’ll regret going with Vista. And use Google for this shit, Jesus. There’s a million tutorials on changing your operating system, so you’re just wasting our time by helping you when you can find your own help much faster.
[/quote]
^

And, once you have your new OS downloaded (or booted up from a disk if you buy it) it’s simple, it basically installs by itself with a few clicks here and there.[/quote]
Fuck you

Read full topic

item.title: Switching from Xp
item.dc:creator: @asyo4 asyo4
item.description:
@asyo4 wrote:

the elve age:

Fuck this entire post. Screw Vista; Halo 2 wasn’t even that great when I played it on my brother’s Win7.

Exactly, was about to say why would you change your entire os for 1 game, lol.

Read full topic

item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Fuck this entire post. Screw Vista; Halo 2 wasn’t even that great when I played it on my brother’s Win7.

item.title: Switching from Xp
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

winxp4life

there is a patch probably for the halo game.

Read full topic

item.title: Switching from Xp
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

you might want to make a recovery disk because you will not be able to restore it to factory settings since your changing the OS and Windows 7 is not any better then Vista all Microsoft did was add some more features. Also, if your planning on downloading a torrent or whatever to get vista it’s not worth it because you will need a activation key to install the software properly without the key you will only be able to use Vista for a certain amount of time and they will limit what you can do.

Read full topic

item.title: Switching from Xp
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Great. I’ll start on it now. Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Switching from Xp
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“ollie123, post:9, topic:443176”]Nothing can go wrong during the install that will harm your computer enough that you will have to buy a new one. The only thing that could happen is that you could lose your data, and I hope you’re smart enough to know to back it all up first anyway.[/quote]Of course. So all it is, is just getting the operating system from online, put it on a disk, put the disk in computer and let it install?

Read full topic

item.title: Switching from Xp
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

Nothing can go wrong during the install that will harm your computer enough that you will have to buy a new one. The only thing that could happen is that you could lose your data, and I hope you’re smart enough to know to back it all up first anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Switching from Xp
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

I don’t think its compatible for Windows 7… Only vista.

Anyways, I honestly don’t want to screw up my computer, like installing goes wrong, my computer can’t handle it, and boom I’m out a $400 dollar comp,

Read full topic

item.title: Switching from Xp
item.dc:creator: @dain_bramage dain bramage
item.description:
@dain_bramage wrote:

I find it funny how people think Vista is all evil and Windows 7 is god.
If you’ve actually used Vista, you would know what I mean.

Read full topic

item.title: Switching from Xp
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

I don’t know why you’d want to go to Vista to begin with; Windows 7 is 100x better.

Read full topic

item.title: Switching from Xp
item.dc:creator: @Sulterize Sulterize
item.description:
@Sulterize wrote:

Microsoft no longer sells Windows Vista, although they do still support it. I’m quite sure you can find it online somewhere for a decent price.

Read full topic

item.title: Switching from Xp
item.dc:creator: @Jacob5 Jacob_
item.description:
@Jacob5 wrote:

Lin:

Go with Windows 7. You’ll regret going with Vista. And use Google for this shit, Jesus. There’s a million tutorials on changing your operating system, so you’re just wasting our time by helping you when you can find your own help much faster.

^

And, once you have your new OS downloaded (or booted up from a disk if you buy it) it’s simple, it basically installs by itself with a few clicks here and there.

Read full topic
